news.title: Chris Mason: Brexit back in the news - but what do both UK and EU want?
news.summary: Expect talk of haggling, fish, cash and courts as the summit risks inflaming old Brexit rows.

news.title: Gary Lineker expected to leave the BBC
news.summary: It comes after he faced criticism for sharing a social media post about Zionism.

news.title: Joe Biden diagnosed with 'aggressive' prostate cancer
news.summary: The former US president was diagnosed on Friday after seeing a doctor for urinary symptoms.

news.title: Olympic gold swimmer left ‘broken’ by coach's harsh regime and weight comments
news.summary: Gold medallist Ruta Meilutytė describes toxic training environment under esteemed trainer Jon Rudd at top swim club.

news.title: Solving the mystery of a dinosaur mass grave at the 'River of Death'
news.summary: A group of researchers have come to Pipestone Creek in Canada to figure out why thousands of dinosaurs are buried here.

news.title: GP patients to help NHS find more infected blood victims
news.summary: The NHS is trying to find many hundreds of people exposed to the virus via contaminated blood in the 1970s, 80s and 90s.

news.title: Water voles are almost extinct - could glitter save them?
news.summary: It is hoped edible glitter could help conservationists to track the shy species in the wild.

news.title: Romania: Liberal mayor Dan beats nationalist in tense race for presidency
news.summary: Nicusor Dan fights off a strong challenge from a right-wing nationalist after months of political turbulence.

news.title: The inside story of a council held to ransom in cyber-attack
news.summary: The BBC investigates one of the most damaging ranswomare attacks on a UK local council.

news.title: Analysis: Biden's cancer diagnosis is another formidable challenge
news.summary: Over the course of his public life, Joe Biden has defined himself by his persistence and endurance.

news.title: The Papers: EU talks 'down to the wire' and 'Brexit betrayal'
news.summary: The papers lead on today's upcoming EU summit, as talks about the deal went on until just before the meeting.

news.title: British mountaineer sets record 19th Everest summit
news.summary: Kenton Cool has broken his own record for the most climbs up the world's tallest peak by a non-sherpa.

news.title: Met Police silent over Strand crash, says victim's mum
news.summary: Aalia Mahomed died at the scene on The Strand in March after a van crashed into a pedestrian area.

news.title: Portugal PM's party wins snap election but falls short of majority
news.summary: The ruling right-of-centre Democratic Alliance of PM Luís Montenegro wins elections, amid a far-right surge.

news.title: Town mourns firefighters and father lost in fire
news.summary: A book of condolence will be opened at a council's HQ from 09:00 BST following Thursday's fire.
